name: Magus of the Moon
text: Nonbasic lands are Mountains.

editions.flavor: Tidal forces of the blood moon wrench and buckle the land, drawing monoliths of stone and soil toward the flaming orb.

name: Magus of the Scroll
text: {3}, {T}: Name a card. Reveal a card at random from your hand. If it's the named card, Magus of the Scroll deals 2 damage to target creature or player.

name: Magus of the Tabernacle
text: All creatures have "At the beginning of your upkeep, sacrifice this creature unless you pay {1}."

editions.flavor: The Tabernacle's disciples channel the emanations from Pendrell Vale, spreading its paradoxical demand to be both worshipped and left alone.

name: Magus of the Unseen
text: {1}{U}, {T}: Untap target artifact an opponent controls and gain control of it until end of turn. It gains haste until end of turn. When you lose control of the artifact, tap it.

name: Magus of the Vineyard
text: At the beginning of each player's precombat main phase, add {G}{G} to that player's mana pool.

editions.flavor: Battered and beaten by years of salt and claw, he never ceased to walk, and to seed. Only now, in this time of rebirth, do his seeds take root.
Battered and beaten by years of salt and claw, he never ceased to walk, and to seed. Only now, in this time of rebirth, do his seeds take root.

name: Magus of the Wheel
text: {1}{R}, {T}, Sacrifice Magus of the Wheel: Each player discards his or her hand, then draws seven cards.

editions.flavor: "Fate is not as fixed as you might think."

name: Magus of the Will
text: {2}{B}, {T}, Exile Magus of the Will: Until end of turn, you may play cards from your graveyard. If a card would be put into your graveyard from anywhere this turn, exile that card instead.

editions.flavor: "These eyes have shown me the flaws of flesh."

name: Mahamoti Djinn
text: Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)

editions.flavor: Of royal blood among the spirits of the air, the Mahamoti djinn rides on the wings of the winds. As dangerous in the gambling hall as he is in battle, he is a master of trickery and misdirection.

name: Major Teroh
text:
Flying
{3}{W}{W}, Sacrifice Major Teroh: Exile all black creatures.

editions.flavor: "I am the holy wind that shall avenge the Cabal's victims."

name: Make a Stand
text: Creatures you control get +1/+0 and gain indestructible until end of turn. (Damage and effects that say "destroy" don't destroy them.)

editions.flavor: For a moment they stood tall, all fear forgotten.

name: Make a Wish
text: Return two cards at random from your graveyard to your hand.

editions.flavor: In Gavony wishing is taken as a sign of weakness, yet the wells usually brim with silver.

name: Make Mischief
text: Make Mischief deals 1 damage to target creature or player. Create a 1/1 red Devil creature token. It has "When this creature dies, it deals 1 damage to target creature or player."

editions.flavor: A tidy desk is as good as an invitation.

name: Make Obsolete
text: Creatures your opponents control get -1/-1 until end of turn.

editions.flavor: Yesterday's marvels are today's antiques.

name: Makeshift Mannequin
text: Return target creature card from your graveyard to the battlefield with a mannequin counter on it. For as long as that creature has a mannequin counter on it, it has "When this creature becomes the target of a spell or ability, sacrifice it."

editions.flavor:
"This vulgar mimicry will end now."
—Desmera, perfect of Wren's Run

"This vulgar mimicry will end now."
—Desmera, perfect of Wren's Run

name: Makeshift Mauler
text: As an additional cost to cast Makeshift Mauler, exile a creature card from your graveyard.

editions.flavor:
"It always amazes me what perfectly good things people throw away."
—Ludevic, necro-alchemist

"It always amazes me what perfectly good things people throw away."
—Ludevic, necro-alchemist

name: Makindi Aeronaut
text: Flying

editions.flavor: "The Eldrazi have surprised us before. It's my job to make sure that never happens again."

name: Makindi Griffin
text: Flying

editions.flavor: As the hedrons began to coalesce into colossal Eldrazi superstructures, the griffins were forced to seek new territory lest their aeries be crushed between the massive stone monoliths.
As the hedrons began to coalesce into colossal Eldrazi superstructures, the griffins were forced to seek new territory lest their aeries be crushed between the massive stone monoliths.

name: Makindi Patrol
text: Rally — Whenever Makindi Patrol or another Ally enters the battlefield under your control, creatures you control gain vigilance until end of turn.

editions.flavor: Working with his noble mount, he notices every form on the horizon, every scent in the air, every tremor in the earth.

name: Makindi Shieldmate
text:
Defender
Whenever Makindi Shieldmate or another Ally enters the battlefield under your control, you may put a +1/+1 counter on Makindi Shieldmate.

editions.flavor: The more who rely on him, the more resolute he becomes.

name: Makindi Sliderunner
text:
Trample
Landfall — Whenever a land enters the battlefield under your control, Makindi Sliderunner gets +1/+1 until end of turn.

editions.flavor: After a battle, it breaks the hillsides into manageable pieces to prepare for next time.

name: Malachite Golem
text: {1}{G}: Malachite Golem gains trample until end of turn.

editions.flavor: Centuries before the first branches of the Tangle gave shelter from the suns' cold light, the shadows of golems were Mirrodin's only shade.

name: Malachite Talisman
text: Whenever a player casts a green spell, you may pay {3}. If you do, untap target permanent.

name: Malach of the Dawn
text:
Flying
{W}{W}{W}: Regenerate Malach of the Dawn.

editions.flavor:
"The sun rises, but the world still feels dark. Pray for the arrival of the malachim—they'll bring Dawn to the world and to our hearts."
—Sister Betje, Miracles of the Saints

name: Malakir Bloodwitch
text:
Flying, protection from white
When Malakir Bloodwitch enters the battlefield, each opponent loses life equal to the number of Vampires you control. You gain life equal to the life lost this way.

name: Malakir Cullblade
text: Whenever a creature an opponent controls dies, put a +1/+1 counter on Malakir Cullblade.

editions.flavor: Each cut stains his blade with fresh blood that he samples to increase his strength.

name: Malakir Familiar
text:
Flying, deathtouch
Whenever you gain life, Malakir Familiar gets +1/+1 until end of turn.

editions.flavor: "They are deadly, and they are loyal. We can spare them a little blood."—Harak, Malakir bloodwitch

name: Malakir Soothsayer
text: Cohort — {T}, Tap an untapped Ally you control: You draw a card and you lose 1 life.

editions.flavor: "Your blood whispers secrets your mind could never comprehend."

name: Malevolent Awakening
text: {1}{B}{B}, Sacrifice a creature: Return target creature card from your graveyard to your hand.

editions.flavor: The most popular pit fighters are brought back for encore performances.

name: Malevolent Whispers
text:
Gain control of target creature until end of turn. Untap that creature. It gets +2/+0 and gains haste until end of turn. 
Madness {3}{R} (If you discard this card, discard it into exile. When you do, cast it for its madness cost or put it into your graveyard.)

name: Malfegor
text:
Flying
When Malfegor enters the battlefield, discard your hand. Each opponent sacrifices a creature for each card discarded this way.

editions.flavor: A demon cannot be trusted, and a dragon will not be ruled.
A demon cannot be trusted, and a dragon will not be ruled.
A demon cannot be trusted, and a dragon will not be ruled.

name: Malfegor Avatar
text:
Whenever a creature enters the battlefield under your control, if it was unearthed, it gets +3/+0.
Whenever a creature you control is exiled, if it was unearthed, shuffle that card into its owner's library.

editions.flavor: CON Participation Avatar

name: Malfunction
text:
Enchant artifact or creature
When Malfunction enters the battlefield, tap enchanted permanent.
Enchanted permanent doesn't untap during its controller's untap step.

editions.flavor: "They don't make them like they used to."

name: Malice
text: Destroy target nonblack creature. It can't be regenerated.

editions.set: Duel Decks: Ajani vs. Nicol Bolas

name: Malicious Advice
text: Tap X target artifacts, creatures, and/or lands. You lose X life.

editions.flavor:
"Rule through fear, Darigaaz. Only if the dragons feel terror will they truly be your servants."
—Tevesh Szat

name: Malicious Affliction
text:
Morbid — When you cast Malicious Affliction, if a creature died this turn, you may copy Malicious Affliction and may choose a new target for the copy.
Destroy target nonblack creature.

editions.flavor:
"Such an affliction appears to seek out the pure."
—Byro, plague doctor

"Such an affliction appears to seek out the pure."
—Byro, plague doctor

name: Malicious Intent
text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature has "{T}: Target creature can't block this turn."

editions.flavor: As peace returned to Thraben, some cathars made the mistake of letting down their guard.

name: Malignant Growth
text:
Cumulative upkeep {1} (At the beginning of your upkeep, put an age counter on this permanent, then sacrifice it unless you pay its upkeep cost for each age counter on it.)
At the beginning of your upkeep, put a growth counter on Malignant Growth.
At the beginning of each opponent's draw step, that player draws an additional card for each growth counter on Malignant Growth, then Malignant Growth deals damage to the player equal to the number of cards he or she drew this way.

name: Malignus
text:
Malignus's power and toughness are each equal to half the highest life total among your opponents, rounded up.
Damage that would be dealt by Malignus can't be prevented.

editions.flavor: It descended on Estwald like a sudden storm. Moments later, only ashes and agony remained.

name: Mammoth Harness
text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature loses flying.
Whenever enchanted creature blocks or becomes blocked by a creature, the other creature gains first strike until end of turn.

name: Mammoth Umbra
text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +3/+3 and has vigilance.
Totem armor (If enchanted creature would be destroyed, instead remove all damage from it and destroy this Aura.)

name: Manabarbs
text: Whenever a player taps a land for mana, Manabarbs deals 1 damage to that player.

editions.flavor:
"I don't know why people say a double-edged sword is bad. It's a sword. With two edges."
—Kamahl, pit fighter

"I don't know why people say a double-edged sword is bad. It's a sword. With two edges."
—Kamahl, pit fighter

"I don't know why people say a double-edged sword is bad. It's a sword. With two edges."
—Kamahl, pit fighter

name: Mana Bloom
text:
Mana Bloom enters the battlefield with X charge counters on it.
Remove a charge counter from Mana Bloom: Add one mana of any color to your mana pool. Activate this ability only once each turn.
At the beginning of your upkeep, if Mana Bloom has no charge counters on it, return it to its owner's hand.

name: Manabond
text: At the beginning of your end step, you may reveal your hand and put all land cards from it onto the battlefield. If you do, discard your hand.

name: Mana Breach
text: Whenever a player casts a spell, that player returns a land he or she controls to its owner's hand.

editions.flavor: The mana that binds the world together can also tear it apart.
The wizard had it all—until she tried to use it.

name: Mana Cache
text:
At the beginning of each player's end step, put a charge counter on Mana Cache for each untapped land that player controls.
Remove a charge counter from Mana Cache: Add {C} to your mana pool. Any player may activate this ability but only during his or her turn before the end step.

name: Mana Chains
text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature has "Cumulative upkeep {1}." (At the beginning of its controller's upkeep, that player puts an age counter on it, then sacrifices it unless he or she pays its upkeep cost for each age counter on it.)

editions.flavor:
"The Lord of the Wastes must be destroyed; I am bound to this destiny by the chains of fate. If only Gerrard would see his part."
—Sisay, journal

name: Mana-Charged Dragon
text:
Flying, trample
Join forces — Whenever Mana-Charged Dragon attacks or blocks, each player starting with you may pay any amount of mana. Mana-Charged Dragon gets +X/+0 until end of turn, where X is the total amount of mana paid this way.

name: Mana Clash
text: You and target opponent each flip a coin. Mana Clash deals 1 damage to each player whose coin comes up tails. Repeat this process until both players' coins come up heads on the same flip.

name: Manacles of Decay
text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature can't attack.
{B}: Enchanted creature gets -1/-1 until end of turn.
{R}: Enchanted creature can't block this turn.

name: Mana Confluence
text: {T}, Pay 1 life: Add one mana of any color to your mana pool.

editions.flavor: Five rivers encircle Theros, flowing with waters more ancient than the world itself.

name: Mana Crypt
text:
At the beginning of your upkeep, flip a coin. If you lose the flip, Mana Crypt deals 3 damage to you.
{T}: Add {C}{C} to your mana pool.

editions.flavor: An utterly silent chamber, submitted by an artificer who wished to remain anonymous.

name: Mana Cylix
text: {1}, {T}: Add one mana of any color to your mana pool.

editions.flavor: Those who dismiss the cylix as an ordinary wooden bowl are blind to the true measure of its worth.
Overflowing with visions of the possible future, it lends power to those in the present.

name: Mana Drain
text: Counter target spell. At the beginning of your next main phase, add an amount of {C} to your mana pool equal to that spell's converted mana cost.

editions.flavor:
"Power is wasted on the weak. They never keep it for long."
—Nicol Bolas

name: Mana Echoes
text: Whenever a creature enters the battlefield, you may add an amount of {C} to your mana pool equal to the number of creatures you control that share a creature type with it.

editions.flavor: When the ground is saturated with mana, even the lightest footstep can bring it to the surface.

name: Mana Flair
text: Add {R} to your mana pool for each nonland permanent by the artist of your choice.

editions.flavor:
What began as black
Has slowly shifted to red.
Fickle color pie.

name: Mana Flare
text: Whenever a player taps a land for mana, that player adds one mana to his or her mana pool of any type that land produced.

name: Manaforce Mace
text:
Domain — Equipped creature gets +1/+1 for each basic land type among lands you control.
Equip {3}

editions.flavor: As the shards merged, relics once thought mundane regained forgotten powers.

name: Manaforge Cinder
text: {1}: Add {B} or {R} to your mana pool. Activate this ability no more than three times each turn.

editions.flavor: Cinder mystics set traps for sluaghs and other spirits of flame, seeking to extract the secrets of the fire their own hearts have lost.

name: Mana Geyser
text: Add {R} to your mana pool for each tapped land your opponents control.

editions.flavor: The Quicksilver Sea hissed and bubbled at the indignity. The Vulshok shaman just smiled.
The Quicksilver Sea hissed and bubbled at the indignity. The Vulshok shaman just smiled.

name: Managorger Hydra
text:
Trample
Whenever a player casts a spell, put a +1/+1 counter on Managorger Hydra.

name: Manakin
text: {T}: Add {C} to your mana pool.

editions.flavor: Hanna regarded Squee sternly. "Because it's not a toy, no matter how much it may look like one," she said, taking the manakin from him.

name: Mana Leak
text: Counter target spell unless its controller pays {3}.

editions.flavor:
"If a man will begin with certainties, he shall end in doubts."
—Sir Francis Bacon, The Advancement of Learning

"The fatal flaw in every plan is the assumption that you know more than your enemy."
—Volrath
The fatal flaw in every plan is the assumption that you know more than your enemy.
The fatal flaw in every plan is the assumption that you know more than your enemy.

"The fatal flaw in every plan is the assumption that you know more than your enemy."
—Volrath

"The fatal flaw in every plan is the assumption that you know more than your enemy."
—Volrath
The fatal flaw in every plan is the assumption that you know more than your enemy.
The fatal flaw in every plan is the assumption that you know more than your enemy.
The fatal flaw in every plan is the assumption that you know more than your enemy.

name: Mana Leech
text:
You may choose not to untap Mana Leech during your untap step.
{T}: Tap target land. It doesn't untap during its controller's untap step for as long as Mana Leech remains tapped.

name: Manalith
text: {T}: Add one mana of any color to your mana pool.

editions.flavor: Planeswalkers seek out great monuments throughout the Multiverse, knowing that their builders were unknowingly drawn by the convergence of mana in the area.

name: Mana Matrix
text: Instant and enchantment spells you cast cost up to {2} less to cast.

name: Mana Maze
text: Players can't cast spells that share a color with the spell most recently cast this turn.

editions.flavor:
"Those who know only one path to victory can never hope to triumph."
—The Blind Seer

name: Manamorphose
text:
Add two mana in any combination of colors to your mana pool.
Draw a card.

editions.flavor: For a moment, objects of pure mana glimmered in the wonderstruck boggart's hands. In the next moment, they were in his mouth, as he chewed contentedly.

"Master the chaotic forces of nature, and you shall master magic."
—Yare-Tiva, warden of Gramur forest

name: Manaplasm
text: Whenever you cast a spell, Manaplasm gets +X/+X until end of turn, where X is that spell's converted mana cost.

editions.flavor: Urak froze when he heard it. That was his first mistake. He turned and cast a dramatic ward spell. That was his last.
Urak froze when he heard it. That was his first mistake. He turned and cast a dramatic ward spell. That was his last.

name: Mana Prism
text:
{T}: Add {C} to your mana pool.
{1}, {T}: Add one mana of any color to your mana pool.

name: Mana Reflection
text: If you tap a permanent for mana, it produces twice as much of that mana instead.

editions.flavor: Despite its darkness, Shadowmoor doesn't want for growth. Legions of creeping things thrive in the shade.

name: Mana Screw
text: {1}: Flip a coin. If you win the flip, add {2} to your mana pool. Play this ability only any time you could play an instant.

editions.flavor: There was no darker or more evil creation in all the multiverse than that of the mana screw.

name: Mana Seism
text: Sacrifice any number of lands, then add that much {C} to your mana pool.

editions.flavor:
"It is the nature of humanity not to worry about tomorrow, especially when there's a good chance they won't live to see the end of today."
—Kiku, Night's Flower

name: Mana Severance
text: Search your library for any number of land cards and exile them. Then shuffle your library.

editions.flavor:
"And when this land is wasted, where will we go?"
—Thalakos lament

name: Mana Short
text: Tap all lands target player controls and empty his or her mana pool.

editions.flavor:
"Remove their power, and their will to fight will follow."
—Tolarian wizard

name: Mana Skimmer
text:
Flying
Whenever Mana Skimmer deals damage to a player, tap target land that player controls. That land doesn't untap during its controller's next untap step.

editions.flavor: They traverse the mana-starved wastes in search of richer lands.

name: Mana Tithe
text: Counter target spell unless its controller pays {1}.

editions.flavor:
"Those who seek to upset the balance must be taxed for such ambitions."
—Verithain, mesa high priest

name: Mana Vapors
text: Lands target player controls don't untap during his or her next untap step.

editions.flavor: The scent of magic can rob you of your senses, blinding you to the world.

name: Mana Vault
text:
Mana Vault doesn't untap during your untap step.
At the beginning of your upkeep, you may pay {4}. If you do, untap Mana Vault.
At the beginning of your draw step, if Mana Vault is tapped, it deals 1 damage to you.
{T}: Add {C}{C}{C} to your mana pool.

name: Mana Vortex
text:
When you cast Mana Vortex, counter it unless you sacrifice a land.
At the beginning of each player's upkeep, that player sacrifices a land.
When there are no lands on the battlefield, sacrifice Mana Vortex.

name: Mana Web
text: Whenever a land an opponent controls is tapped for mana, tap all lands that player controls that could produce any type of mana that land could produce.

name: Manaweft Sliver
text: Sliver creatures you control have "{T}: Add one mana of any color to your mana pool."

editions.flavor:
"I see in their interconnectedness a strange embodiment of the natural order."
—Dionus, elvish archdruid

name: Mangara of Corondor
text: {T}: Exile Mangara of Corondor and target permanent.

editions.flavor: "I have been brought to this place and I cannot leave. I may be free of the amber, but I am still in prison."

name: Mangara's Blessing
text:
You gain 5 life.
When a spell or ability an opponent controls causes you to discard Mangara's Blessing, you gain 2 life, and you return Mangara's Blessing from your graveyard to your hand at the beginning of the next end step.

name: Mangara's Equity
text:
As Mangara's Equity enters the battlefield, choose black or red.
At the beginning of your upkeep, sacrifice Mangara's Equity unless you pay {1}{W}.
Whenever a creature of the chosen color deals damage to you or a white creature you control, Mangara's Equity deals that much damage to that creature.

name: Mangara's Tome
text:
When Mangara's Tome enters the battlefield, search your library for five cards, exile them in a face-down pile, and shuffle that pile. Then shuffle your library.
{2}: The next time you would draw a card this turn, instead put the top card of the exiled pile into its owner's hand.

name: Manglehorn
text:
When Manglehorn enters the battlefield, you may destroy target artifact.
Artifacts your opponents control enter the battlefield tapped.

editions.flavor:
"Rely too much on your weapons and watch your dreams shatter in your hands."
—Rhonas, god of strength

name: Maniacal Rage
text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +2/+2 and can't block.

editions.flavor: The spikes of sangrite made the goblin stronger, but they didn't make him any smarter.
Only by sacrificing any semblance of defense could Gerrard best Greven.
Only by sacrificing any semblance of defense could Gerrard best Greven.
Only by sacrificing any semblance of defense could Gerrard best Greven.
"Remember me?" Tahngarth roared. "Now I'll repay you for my stay on Rath"

name: Manic Scribe
text:
When Manic Scribe enters the battlefield, each opponent puts the top three cards of his or her library into his or her graveyard.
Delirium — At the beginning of each opponent's upkeep, if there are four or more card types among cards in your graveyard, that player puts the top three cards of his or her library into his or her graveyard.

name: Manic Vandal
text: When Manic Vandal enters the battlefield, destroy target artifact.

editions.flavor: It's fun. He doesn't need another reason.
It's fun. He doesn't need another reason.

name: Manifold Insights
text: Reveal the top ten cards of your library. Starting with the next opponent in turn order, each opponent chooses a different nonland card from among them. Put the chosen cards into your hand and the rest on the bottom of your library in a random order.

name: Manipulate Fate
text:
Search your library for three cards, exile them, then shuffle your library.
Draw a card.

name: Mannichi, the Fevered Dream
text: {1}{R}: Switch each creature's power and toughness until end of turn.

editions.flavor:
"Early in his reign, Konda fell ill. His head burned with fever, and he saw visions of his future. In them, he saw a spirit-child, and, in that child's eyes, a way to make his empire last forever."
—The History of Kamigawa

name: Man of Measure
text:
As long as you're shorter than an opponent, Man of Measure has first strike and gets +0/+1.
As long as you're taller than an opponent, Man of Measure gets +1/+0.

editions.flavor: You need to be this tall to play this card.

name: Manor Gargoyle
text:
Defender
Manor Gargoyle has indestructible as long as it has defender.
{1}: Until end of turn, Manor Gargoyle loses defender and gains flying.

editions.flavor: Nothing could break it but the fall.

name: Manor Skeleton
text:
Haste
{1}{B}: Regenerate Manor Skeleton.

editions.flavor: Lungs dried to parchment wheeze blasphemies within a cage of bleached bone.

name: Man-o'-War
text: When Man-o'-War enters the battlefield, return target creature to its owner's hand.

editions.flavor:
"Beauty to the eye does not always translate to the touch."
—Naimah, Femeref philospher

—Naimah, Femeref philosopher
